title: Portland Free Stuff
name: Portland Free Stuff
description:
A Map by Us3rname

This map is made from Nancy Levenson's list on About.com

If you're low on cash but you still want to get out of the house, you're in luck. Here's a list of parks, attractions, and neighborhoods you can visit for free.

properties.name: Bridgeport Brewery Tours
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 1313 NW Marshall Street, Portland, ORBrewery tours are given daily at 2:00 and 5:00pm.

properties.name: Farmer's Market Wednesdays until end of October
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Burside and 12th, Portland, ORWhat: Local farmers and food vendors sell the goods they’ve grown or made locally. In addition to excellent produce, you’ll find baked goods, meats, cheeses, and a variety of gourmet foods. Where: Wednesdays in the south park blocks between SW Salmon and Main. from 10 a.m. – 2 p.m., April - October

properties.name: Forest Park
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   via About.com What: With more than 5,000 acres to explore, Forest Park is the largest city park in the United States. There are 50 miles of trails and 30 miles of gated roadways for mountain biking. Visit Forest Park for a run, hike, bike ride, or horseback ride. Where: Because the park is so large, there are many entrance points. Check the maps at the Friends of Forest Park website When: Daily 5 a.m. to 10 p.m.

properties.name: Hoyt Arboretum
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 4000 SW Fairview Blvd, Portland, ORvia About.com What: The definition of arboretum is “A botanical garden devoted to trees.” Here, you can walk among more than 1,100 species. Twelve miles of trails wind through the park, and the Visitor Center provides maps, trail guides, and detailed plant information. Where: 2 miles west of downtown near the zoo. See the website for directions. When: Grounds: Daily, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. Visitor Center: 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. M – F, closes at 3 p.m. on Saturday.

properties.name: International Rose Test Garden
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname Washington Parkvia About.com What: This garden receives and plants roses from all over the world. 8,000 rose bushes are on display here. Bring a picnic and savor the views of downtown and Mount Hood. Don’t forget your camera! Where: 400 SW Kingston Ave., (inside Washington Park) When: Daily from 7:30 a.m. - 9:00 p.m. The roses begin blooming in early May and peak around the first week of June.

properties.name: McMenamin's Edgefield Brewery Tour
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 2126 SW Halsey Street, Portland, OregonCall ahead Local: (503) 669-8610 Elsewhere: (800) 669-8610 The largest of McMenamins\' breweries, the Edgefield Brewery opened in 1991 in the old cannery building of the former Multnomah County Poor Farm. Impressive artwork by Joe Cotter and Scott Young depicts the history of beer along the walls and two of McMenamins\' more popular brews originated here: Black Rabbit Porter and Transformer Ale.

properties.name: Pioneer Courthouse Square
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 715 SW Morrison, Portland, OR, 97205via About.com What: A public square in the center of downtown, known as “Portland’s living room.” The square hosts hundreds of events each year, including concerts and cultural fairs. In the warmer months, it’s a great place to sit and people watch. Where: The block between SW 6th and Broadway and between SW Yamhill and Morrison When: The square never closes. For events, check the online calendar.

properties.name: Powell's City of Books
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  1005 W Burnside; portland, orvia About.com What: A must-see bookstore that takes up an entire city block and holds more than a million volumes. Every Portlander must get lost here at least once. Beyond books, Powell’s also has a coffee shop and an art gallery in the Pearl Room. Where: Enter at the Corner of W. Burnside and 10th Ave. When: Daily 9 a.m. to 11 p.m. with shorter hours on holidays.

properties.name: Saturday Farmer's Market April until December
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   via About.com What: Local farmers and food vendors sell the goods they’ve grown or made locally. In addition to excellent produce, you’ll find baked goods, meats, cheeses, and a variety of gourmet foods. Where: Saturdays in the south park blocks between SW Harrison and Montgomery from 8:30 a.m. – 2 p.m.

properties.name: Saturday market
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   108 W Burnside St, Portland, ORvia About.com What: Hundreds of vendors sell imports, handmade goods and foods from around the world. In nicer weather, enjoy entertainment from live musicians, jugglers, and a variety of street performers. This is a great place to bring visitors. Where: Underneath the Burnside Bridge on the west side of downtown Portland. When:Saturdays and Sundays from March – December 24. The market is also open for an entire week leading up to Christmas Eve for what’s called “The Festival of the Last Minute.”

properties.name: Widmer Free Brewery Tours Fridays and Saturdays
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 929 N Russell, Portland, ORCome Take our Free Widmer Brewery Tour! Regular tour times are: Fridays at 3:00 pm Saturdays at 11:00am & 12:00pm Reservations are required. Group sizes are limited. Please call 503-281-2437 to make your reservations.
